artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Izumiya Ichibei
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: vertical ōban triptych; a (left): two kneeling men; man at left wears white kimono with grey geometric patterns and grey obi; man at right wears blue kimono with black obi; both men look upward toward right; b (center): man seated on raised platform, wearing expansive garment that is primarily purple with grey and white arc pattern and round medallion with white flowers; c (right): two kneeling and bowing figures; man at left wears black and gold garment with hexagonal medallions with flowers on sleeves and shoulders and skirt of blue, grey and black stripes; woman at right wears purple and pink kimono with flowers and floral obi with red ground
markings: censor seals: Yoshimura 吉村, Muramatsu 村松; publisher\'s seal: Izumiichi
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: right: 香蝶楼豊國画 {Kōchōrō Toyokuni ga} | left: 一陽齋豊國画 {Ichiyōsai Toyokuni ga}
text: Related to the play "Aoto banashi" 青砥調, performed at the Ichimura Theater in the 1st month of 1849.
title: Trial Scene from The Story of the Judge Aoto Fujitsuna
